arts.ttl: The lowdown on Millwall 0 Hull City 1 - Lions urgently need transfer window reinforcements
arts.sum: Millwall goalkeeper Lukas Jensen was called into action 10 minutes in, out quickly to block Abu Kamara’s effort after he was sent through on goal. The Lions responded well to that and in the 19th minute had a chance of their own, Duncan Watmore broke through and the ball found its way to George Honeyman but the former Hull captain curled his effort over the bar.

arts.ttl: ‘We’re convinced with his skills’ - Crystal Palace boss delivers verdict on signing Romain Esse from Millwall
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner admitted Romain Esse’s profile was something his Crystal Palace side was lacking before heading into the January transfer window. “Crystal Palace have had a lot of success from signing young players from the Championship.

arts.ttl: Palace sign Millwall's Esse on contract until 2030
arts.sum: Crystal Palace complete their first signing of the January transfer window as Millwall winger Romain Esse, 19, joins on a deal until 2030.

arts.ttl: Liverpool loanee impresses Millwall boss as he makes Championship playing return
arts.sum: Millwall head coach Alex Neil was totally happy with the performance of Liverpool loanee Calum Scanlon in today’s 1-0 defeat to Hull City. “The game, probably at the start, was a little bit quick for him, in terms of getting his head up and maybe feeding a couple down the side.

arts.ttl: ‘We are stretched at top end of pitch’ - Millwall boss gives verdict after Championship loss to Hull City
arts.sum: “When we did get the ball down via the wing-backs we looked threatening. The two lowest scoring clubs in the Championship produced a game starved of major chances with the outcome decided by Jake Cooper’s own goal.

arts.ttl: Hull boss Selles delighted after away day victory against Millwall
arts.sum: “We are doing it in the way we want to do it, building things, trying to control the game, be aggressive and play through the lines and keep the ball high and away from our goal. Hull City boss Ruben Selles was delighted with his side’s performance as they left Millwall with all three points on Saturday lunchtime.

arts.ttl: Ruben Selles hails Hull City's crucial away win at Millwall as he makes supporters point
arts.sum: Ruben Selles feels Hull City's 1-0 win at Millwall is the perfect start to a crucial three-game week, with games against QPR and Sheffield United to come. Jake Cooper's own goal in the second half proved crucial as City notched a second successive 1-0 away success, backing up the victory at Blackburn Rovers in the final outing of 2024.

arts.ttl: Millwall boss Alex Neil on Romain Esse’s Crystal Palace transfer
arts.sum: But that is what we want to become as a club – someone who can develop players and try to create assets in the team. When you’re trying to juggle all those balls at the one time – particularly when you have got players missing who can make an impact at the top end, that is certainly a challenge.”

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings vs Millwall as new signings feature in huge away win
arts.sum: A tremendous battling performance from Hull City saw them bag a crucial 1-0 away win at Millwall on Saturday, courtesy of an own goal. Lewie Coyle: Started really well defensively, had a left-footed effort on target and then won a crunching tackle just inside his own half, coming off worse and had to be replaced by Cody Drameh in what was another injury blow for the manager.

arts.ttl: Battling Hull City seal huge away win at Millwall as new signings bring fresh hope
arts.sum: City took the lead just before the hour when Regan Slater's run and cross down the right forced Jake Cooper to turn into his own net at the near post, right in front of a bumper away following from East Yorkshire behind the goal. A scrappy second half was lit up by the amber smoke bombs from the away end when Slater's run down the right and into the box saw Jake Cooper turn into his own net under pressure from Pedro at the near post.
